title: Geth is always 100 blocks behind in Mainnet
body:
#### System information

Geth binary installed from the Ubuntu PPA:

```
$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.10.26-stable
Git Commit: e5eb32acee19cc9fca6a03b10283b7484246b15a
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.18.5
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=go
```

My node configuration is the following:

```
geth --config=/etc/geth/mainnet/config.toml \
    --mainnet \
    --datadir.ancient=/mnt/mydisk/ethereum/ancient \
    --syncmode=snap \
    --http \
    --graphql
```

The BC is using Prysm:

```
$ beacon-chain --version
beacon-chain version Prysm/v3.2.0/3d6d0a12dd189abcd2cfbba1c3d56505a1dd595c. Built at: 2022-12-15 23:40:50+00:00
```

Prysm is started using:

```
beacon-chain --execution-endpoint=$HOME/.ethereum/geth.ipc \
    --checkpoint-sync-url=https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in/ \
    --genesis-beacon-api-url=https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in/ \
    --accept-terms-of-use
```

The node is syncing since three days ago but is still 100 blocks behind.

#### Expected behaviour

Have the node synced with head block.

#### Actual behaviour

Always 100 blocks behind the main chain.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Start a fresh node sync using `syncmode=snap`.

#### Backtrace

Prysm logs

```
feb 15 19:16:54 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:16:54" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=42 inbound=0 outbound=42 prefix=p2p
feb 15 19:16:55 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:16:55" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: timeout from http.Client: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:16:55 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:16:55" level=info msg="Processing block 0xa51ef27d... 5805344/5805382 - estimated time remaining 1m24s" blocksPerSecond=0.5 peers=42 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:16:59 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:16:59" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: got an unexpected error in JSON-RPC response: client is closed: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:16:59 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:16:59" level=info msg="Processing block 0xa51ef27d... 5805344/5805383 - estimated time remaining 19s" blocksPerSecond=2.0 peers=41 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:00 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:00" level=info msg="Processing block 0x1d7528e1... 5805376/5805383 - estimated time remaining 2s" blocksPerSecond=3.4 peers=40 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:00 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:00" level=warning msg="Range is not processed" error="Range had no valid blocks to process" prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:10 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:10" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: timeout from http.Client: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:10 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:10" level=info msg="Processing block 0xa51ef27d... 5805344/5805383 - estimated time remaining 9s" blocksPerSecond=4.0 peers=41 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:11 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:11" level=info msg="Processing block 0x1d7528e1... 5805376/5805384 - estimated time remaining 1s" blocksPerSecond=5.6 peers=42 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:45 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:45" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: got an unexpected error in JSON-RPC response: client is closed: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:45 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:45" level=info msg="Processing block 0xa51ef27d... 5805344/5805386 - estimated time remaining 1m33s" blocksPerSecond=0.5 peers=41 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:46 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:46" level=info msg="Processing block 0x1d7528e1... 5805376/5805386 - estimated time remaining 4s" blocksPerSecond=2.0 peers=40 prefix=initial-sync
feb 15 19:17:54 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:54" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=39 inbound=0 outbound=39 prefix=p2p
feb 15 19:17:55 spartan-0 beacon-chain[5480]: time="2023-02-15 19:17:55" level=warning msg="Block is not processed" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: timeout from http.Client: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync

```

Geth logs:


After checking the `eth.syncing`:

```
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 16635996,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  healedBytecodes: 0,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 0,
  healedTrienodes: 0,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 16636122,
  startingBlock: 0,
  syncedAccountBytes: 36666076925,
  syncedAccounts: 166735952,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 4237482450,
  syncedBytecodes: 639711,
  syncedStorage: 707505821,
  syncedStorageBytes: 151821601890
}
```

Your node is not synced up,

```
feb 15 19:07:26 spartan-0 geth[773]: INFO [02-15|19:07:26.254] State sync in progress                   synced=74.14% state=179.48GiB accounts=166,735,952@34.15GiB slots=707,445,265@141.38GiB codes=639,671@3.95GiB    eta=17h52m26.273s
```

It's still syncing the state with some ETA printed.

you are right @rjl493456442 but now the node is synced and I still have the same problem


And this:

```
> eth.syncing
```
